column3: ACK f1d21ef1c370898ae10569f2a8569bd98d71a981 can't hurt to give an advance warning

> Some time prior to split-off:

    Confirm that compiling with C++17 works.
    Confirm that C++11 compatibility has not been broken.


our current ci configs should take care of this already

ACK f1d21ef1c370898ae10569f2a8569bd98d71a981

> One thing worth noting, is that we cannot bump our Qt to a newer LTS for 0.21.0, without breaking C++11 compatibility.

Perusing all open GUI issues [old repo](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/labels/GUI?q=is%3Aopen+label%3AGUI) / [new repo](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues?q=+is%3Aopen) I don't see any burning issues that need a

This seems consistent with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16684#issuecomment-608079822\n\nI would add a note that 0.21 backports and minor versions *may* begin requiring C++17 as well, depending on what they are (e.g., if consensus code gets added using a C++17 feature, the soft fork rules would require C++17). As such, it's reasonable to say that 0.21.0 is the *last* version a user s
